text: Blessed be the name of the LORD from this time forth and for evermore.
text_kjv: Blessed be the name of the LORD from this time forth and for evermore.
text_niv: Let the name of the Lord be praised,both now and forevermore.
text_esv: Blessed be the name of the LORD from this time forth and forevermore!

text_nasb: Blessed be the name of the LORD From this time forth and forever.
context: Psalm 113 is the first in a series of six Psalms (113-118) known as the Hallel Psalms. These Psalms were traditionally sung during the great Jewish festivals, particularly Passover, Shavuot (Weeks), and Sukkot (Tabernacles). The singing of the Hallel was a communal act of praise and thanksgiving, recalling God's deliverance of Israel from Egypt and celebrating His ongoing faithfulness. Psalm 113 specifically focuses on God's exaltation above all nations and His condescension to care for the lowly. The phrase "Blessed be the name of the LORD" is a common expression of praise in the Old Testament, signifying reverence, adoration, and acknowledgement of God's character and power. The timeframe "from this time forth and for evermore" emphasizes the perpetual nature of God's worthiness of praise and the enduring responsibility of believers to offer Him honor. The Hallel Psalms were typically sung at specific points during the Passover Seder, contributing to the liturgical structure and emotional impact of the celebration. Understanding this historical context illuminates the verse's purpose: to call the community to unwavering and eternal praise of Yahweh.
meaning: Theologically, Psalm 113:2 encapsulates several vital concepts. First, it highlights the inherent worthiness of God's name to receive blessing. "The name of the LORD" is not merely a label; it represents His complete being, His attributes, His character, and His revealed will. To bless God's name is to acknowledge, proclaim, and celebrate all that He is. Second, the verse emphasizes the ongoing nature of our obligation to praise God. The phrase "from this time forth and for evermore" signifies a commitment to continuous, uninterrupted adoration. It's not a fleeting moment of gratitude but a lifelong dedication to glorifying God. This perpetual praise reflects the eternal nature of God Himself. He is unchanging and unwavering in His goodness and faithfulness, therefore, our praise should likewise be constant. Third, the verse implies a covenantal relationship between God and His people. By blessing His name, we are responding to His covenantal love and expressing our loyalty to Him. It acknowledges that He has chosen us, redeemed us, and called us to be His people, and we, in turn, pledge our unending devotion. Finally, this verse anticipates the future culmination of all things when every knee will bow and every tongue confess that Jesus Christ is Lord, to the glory of God the Father. The earthly expression of blessing God's name finds its ultimate fulfillment in the eternal worship of heaven.
application: In our modern lives, Psalm 113:2 challenges us to cultivate a lifestyle of continuous praise. This isn't confined to Sunday morning worship but permeates every aspect of our existence. Practically, this means finding ways to bless God's name "from this time forth and for evermore" in our daily routines. This could involve incorporating prayer and thanksgiving into our morning rituals, actively seeking opportunities to share God's goodness with others, or choosing to respond to challenging situations with faith and trust instead of despair. It might mean consciously refraining from gossip, negativity, or actions that dishonor God's character. Furthermore, it involves making deliberate choices to consume media, engage in conversations, and pursue activities that align with God's values. The verse encourages us to actively seek out opportunities to celebrate God's presence in our lives, even amidst difficulties. For example, maintaining a gratitude journal, regularly spending time in nature appreciating God's creation, or participating in acts of service to demonstrate His love to those in need. Teaching our children to bless the Lord's name from a young age can instill a lifelong habit of reverence and gratitude. It's also vital to recognize that praising God isn't always easy. When we face trials, hardships, or moments of doubt, it can be challenging to maintain an attitude of praise. However, it is precisely in these moments that our commitment to bless God's name "from this time forth and for evermore" is tested and refined. We can choose to lean on His promises, remember His past faithfulness, and trust in His unwavering love, even when we don't understand His plan.
prayer: Heavenly Father, Your name is holy and worthy of all praise. Forgive me for the times I have neglected to acknowledge Your goodness and faithfulness in my life. Help me to cultivate a heart of perpetual gratitude, that I may bless Your name from this time forth and for evermore. Fill me with Your Spirit so that I may recognize Your presence in every moment and respond with unwavering adoration. Teach me to see Your hand at work, even in the midst of trials, and to trust in Your perfect plan. May my life be a living testament to Your glory, reflecting Your love, grace, and mercy to all those around me. In Jesus' name, I pray. Amen.

faqs.answer: To bless God's name signifies acknowledging His inherent worthiness, expressing gratitude for His attributes and actions, and proclaiming His glory to others. It's not about giving God something He lacks, but rather about recognizing and celebrating His divine character. It's an act of reverence and adoration.
faqs.question: Q1: What does it mean to "bless" God's name?

faqs.answer: Continual praise reflects God's unchanging nature and unwavering faithfulness. It reminds us of His constant presence in our lives and strengthens our faith during challenging times. It also cultivates a heart of gratitude and allows us to experience the joy of His presence.
faqs.question: Q2: Why is it important to praise God continually?

faqs.answer: Even amidst struggles, you can bless God's name by remembering His past faithfulness, meditating on His promises, and trusting in His unwavering love. Focus on what you do have to be thankful for, and choose to respond with faith rather than despair.
faqs.question: Q3: How can I bless God's name when I'm struggling?

faqs.answer: Practical ways include incorporating prayer and thanksgiving into your daily routine, sharing God's goodness with others, refraining from negativity, pursuing activities that align with God's values, and spending time in nature appreciating His creation. Acts of service also bless His name.
faqs.question: Q4: What are some practical ways to bless God's name daily?

faqs.answer: This verse finds its fulfillment in the New Testament through the worship of Jesus Christ. As God incarnate, Jesus embodies the name above all names. To bless the name of the Lord now includes acknowledging Jesus as Lord and Savior, offering Him our worship and devotion eternally.
